title: Reduce assets sizes

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [this proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1756733604890239)


Background: Current image optimization process relies on imgbot, which applies relatively mild compression. In addition, the home-background graphics are particularly large and account for the majority of the SignIn module’s size (~90%). Their complexity significantly increase the module’s load weight, delaying the initial experience for new users on slower networks.

Problem: When image assets are oversized, they increase load times, which prevents users from quickly accessing core app features

Solution:
Manually optimize SVGs: Use the latest SVGO 4.0.0 locally to compress SVG files more aggressively than the current imgbot GitHub action.

Remove unused SVGs: Identify and delete SVGs that are imported but not used, as well as those not imported at all (e.g.,olddot-wireframe.svg, lounge.svg).

Simplify complex illustrations: Work with the design team to explore consolidating multiple background images into a single, reusable graphic with a transparent background compatible across all platforms and device sizes. Consider recreating illustrations with fewer or less complex elements and make it reusable.

The heaviest assets after additional compression (above 100 KB) in the project include:
- 759.22 KiB – empty-state_background-fade-dark.png
- 756.22 KiB – empty-state_background-fade-light.png
- 580.06 KiB – home-background--mobile-new.svg - iOS  (small screen)
- 580.06 KiB – home-background--desktop.svg - iOS, desktop and web (large screen),
- 420.18 KiB – home-background--android.svg - android (small screen)
- 420.17 KiB – home-background--mobile.svg - desktop and web (small screen)
- 260.87 KiB – fake-test-drive-employee-receipt.jpg
- 141.10 KiB – eReceipt_background.svg

Expected Outcome:
- Additional compression provide:
  - Web bundle total decrease of ~0.2 MB
  - .apk zipped decrease of ~0.3 MB
- If the home-background is reduced to a single 300 KB graphic:
  - Reduce SignIn module size from ~1.48 MB to ~0.42 MB (~70%)
  - Improve module load times by ~1000 ms (~10%) on a Fast 4G network



<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @c3024</details>

title: Update "Review duplicates" flow

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background
Coming from [this thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1756240422034009), we'd like to update the experience of reviewing duplicate expenses.

## What currently happens
When you're in the **Review duplicates** view and then click into an individual expense, it currently takes you to that expense **in the full-page Inbox view.**

See example below. 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c62f5c75-8a35-4d09-81e4-d706226d7f87

## What we want to happen
When you're in the **Review duplicates** view and then click into an individual expense, it should take you to that expense **right in the same view.** 

See ideal flow below.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d257e006-825f-42c8-972e-8f7649dc0f29

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @ishpaul777</details>

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.2.0-2
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-516/folder/13176675/41237190/864762781
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+1700@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app)
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Have two accounts opened on two different devices or environments.
Prerequisite 2: User B has at least one workspace available.
1. Open the Expensify app.
2. Log in as User A.
3. As User B, on another environment, open any workspace chat,
4. Tap on chat header and select "Members"
5. Invite User A as member.
6. Return to chat and create a manual expense.
7. As User A, open workspace chat.
8. Open the just received expense.
9. Note that a "It´s not here" page, is displayed for some seconds, before expense report appears.

## Expected Result:
Expense report should be automatically displayed, when member of a workspace opens an expense.

## Actual Result:
When opening an expense as workspace chat member, a "It´s not here" page is displayed for some seconds, before expense report appears.

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] iOS: App

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.2.0-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Exploratory
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** qaooxx+375@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Mac / Safari
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. As Admin, create a workspace.
2. Invite Submitter, Approver A, and Approver B.
3. Configure workflow: Approver A approves Submitter’s expenses.
4. As Submitter, submit an expense.
5. Log in as Approver A → observe that the Approve filter is available in the To-Do section.
6. As Admin, change workflow: now Approver B approves Submitter’s expenses.
7. Log in again as Approver A and check To-Do section.

## Expected Result:
Since there are still pending expenses assigned to Approver A, the Approve filter should remain visible in the To-Do section, allowing them to filter and approve existing expenses.

## Actual Result:
After the approver change, expenses assigned to Approver A remain visible in Expenses, but the Approve filter is missing — they cannot filter or approve them from Reports page

## Workaround:
Unknown

___

**Version Number:** 9.2.0-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-570/folder/13176707/41236886/867880396
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** biruknew45+29lmmml7@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Web, mweb, android
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Create a Workspace (non-USD)
3. Go to More features and enable Rules
4. Go to Rules > enable one of the toggle from Expense Reports section
5. Go offline
6. Disable the toggle turned on in step 4
7. Go online

## Expected Result:
Disabling a toggle in the Expense Reports section while offline should not automatically enable eReceipts

## Actual Result:
When a toggle in the Expense Reports section is disabled while offline, eReceipts are automatically enabled for non-USD workspaces once the app goes back online.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] Fix localization: dates not being localized correctly

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem We've identified several places where we are not using our localization properly, leading to using formats that are not used in the selected locale. For example this is with spanish language: In spanish should be something like `19 ago, 2025 a las 12:02PM` or something like that. # Solution Remove any code that uses a hardcoded date format (not based on the locale) as long as the date is used to display information to users. Some examples (but please check if there are more places): - https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L252-L255 - https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/0db6a75d619ac9d6280cf28ec0d2138f2b0ef8b5/src/CONST/index.ts#L432-L453 Replace all of then with the standardized [`dateStyle` and `timeStyle`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/DateTimeFormat/DateTimeFormat) (using one of the values "full", "long", "medium", and "short"), but let's inspect each case to make sure it makes sense to replace it and with which format exactly we want to replace it. Additionally, change [this](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L112) to use `getWeekInfo().firstDay` of the current locale and ensure the calendar component works properly, showing the correct start day according to the locale (FYI 99% sure [this](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/e091028680e8e21729421dee3ec0547880042f59/src/libs/DateUtils.ts#L121) is wrong and 6 should be 7)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 1961470094099753846
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-08-29

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.0-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @quinthar **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1756426753872339) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to workspace chat 2. Create an empty report by clicking + 3. Right click on the created report 4. Observe the comment action menu ## Expected Result: Delete option displayed ## Actual Result: Delete option not displayed ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos
Add any screenshot/video evidence
[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @dominictb
